title: Swan Song/Quick guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Note: With a high enough combat level, it is possible to have all required items worn and in a single inventory. There is also an opportunity to use the Yanille bank during the quest if needed.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Swan Song/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point The Piscatoris Fishing Colony. It can be reached via a boat trip from the river to the west of the Tree Gnome Stronghold.
Official difficultyMaster
DescriptionOut on the edge of the known world, the Piscatoris Fishing Colony stands on the brink of disaster. Angry sea trolls are emerging from the sea and attacking the colonists, preventing them from harvesting the valuable monkfish that live in those waters. A highly experienced adventurer will be needed to drive back the trolls for good. The Colony's director, Herman Caranos, has a particular adventurer in mind: the notoriously amoral Wise Old Man of Draynor Village (allegations of his involvement in a spectacular bank robbery have never been substantiated). If you're in the mood for a bit of combat, jump on the boat on the west side of the Gnome Stronghold, speak to the Colony's director and prepare to fight alongside the Wise Old Man as he embarks on his final adventure - his swan song.
Official lengthMedium
Requirements
  • 100 Quest points
  • 66 Magic (boostable)
  • 62 Cooking (boostable)
  • 62 Fishing (boostable)
  • 45 Smithing (boostable)
  • 42 Firemaking (boostable)
  • 40 Crafting (boostable)
  • Completion of the following quests:
    • One Small Favour
      • Rune Mysteries
      • Shilo Village
        • Jungle Potion
          • Druidic Ritual
    • Garden of Tranquillity
      • Creature of Fenkenstrain
        • Priest in Peril
        • The Restless Ghost
  • The ability to defeat a combat level 170 monster, which is able to use Magic, Melee and can drain Prayer.
Items required
  • 10 mist runes
  • 10 lava runes
  • 5 blood runes
  • 7 bones (obtainable during the quest)
  • An airtight pot – created by using a pot lid on a pot
    • A pot, or
      • a soft clay if making your own pot during quest, or
        • a pickaxe (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own clay during quest
    • A pot lid, or
      • a soft clay if making your own pot lid during quest (note: 2 soft clay needed if making both pot and pot lid), or
        • a pickaxe (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own clay during quest
  • 5 iron bars, or
    • a pickaxe (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own iron during quest
  • 1 set of logs of any kind, or
    • an axe (obtainable during quest) if chopping your own logs during quest
  • A tinderbox (obtainable during the quest)
  • A hammer (obtainable during the quest)
  • A small fishing net (given to you during the quest if you do not have one)
  • A brown apron (given to you during the quest if you do not have one)
Recommended
  • 60 Combat level
  • Teleportation method to the Piscatoris Fishing Colony:
    • 50 coins or a ring of charos – if using Kathy Corkat's boat from west of Tree Gnome Stronghold
    • A Dramen staff or Lunar staff – if using fairy rings AKQ
    • Several Piscatoris teleports can be used to teleport there directly
  • An amulet of glory (to teleport to Draynor Village)
  • A skills necklace (to teleport to the Crafting Guild)
  • A Watchtower teleport tab (or its spell equivalent if you have completed Watchtower). You can also use the Nightmare Zone Grouping teleport.
  • It is best to bring 4 to 5 Admiral pies if boosting Fishing level.
  • Some prayer potions (to offset the Sea Troll Queen's magical Prayer-draining attacks)
  • Some good food/healing
  • Cooking Gauntlets (to reduce the chance of burning the 5 Monkfish caught during the quest)
Enemies to defeat
  • 11 Sea trolls (1 each of levels 65/87/101 and 8 of level 79)
  • Sea Troll Queen (level 170)
Ironman concerns
Consider purchasing the necessary combination runes from the Rewards Guardian of the Mage Training Arena.

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Note: With a high enough combat level, it is possible to have all required items worn and in a single inventory. There is also an opportunity to use the Yanille bank during the quest if needed.

Trollish[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Herman Caranos at the Piscatoris Fishing Colony (north of Fairy ring AKQ); cutscene is optional. ( 1•1•2)…
    1What's the rush?
    1Do you need any help?
    2I'm a brave adventurer! Can I try?

The Wise Old Man[edit | edit source]

Items needed: 5 Blood runes, 10 Mist runes, 10 Lava runes.
  • Talk to the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village.

Battle at the Colony[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Food, Armour, Melee or Ranged weapon, Prayer potions to kill Sea Trolls.
 This fight takes place in an instanced area.
On death, all unprotected items will be moved to a grave outside the instance. Any items left on the ground will be lost.
  • Return to the Colony and talk to the Wise Old Man.
  • Kill the level 79 Sea Trolls and enter the Colony (collect 7 of their bones if needed).
  • Talk to Herman (east building). Note: You will need to click inside of the building as clicking directly on Herman (or the Wise Old Man later) will make your character run outside the building to the north.

Repairing the Colony[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Logs, Tinderbox, 5 Iron bars, Hammer, Small fishing net, Fishing level boosting item if you're below 62, Smithing level boosting item if you're below 45, combat equipment to fight Sea Trolls
  • Talk to Franklin Caranos near the entrance.
  • Use a log on the firebox (not the furnace) and light it in the building with the Furnace symbol. (Franklin will give you a tinderbox if you speak to him again.)
  • Use each of the five iron bars on the Metal Press.
  • Use Iron sheets to repair the western colony perimeter's broken walls. (Franklin will give you a hammer.)
  • Talk to Arnold Lydspor in the bank. (He will give you a Small fishing net if you do not already have one.)
  • Fish 5 Fresh monkfish to the west, you may need a few more if you burn some while cooking.
    • Kill Sea Trolls when they spawn, as they will increase in difficulty. After 2-3 kills, the sea trolls only drop big bones and cannot be used in the next section of the quest.
  • Cook the monkfish in the kitchen, south of the fishing spot. Note: you cannot bank with Arnold to make use of cooking gauntlets.
  • Talk to Arnold.
  • Talk to Franklin.
  • Talk to the Wise Old Man and Herman in the far eastern building.

Raising an Army[edit | edit source]

Items needed: 7 bones, airtight pot OR pot with pot lid, brown apron (can ask Malignius for one).
If not banking afterwards: Food, Armour, Melee or Ranged weapon, Prayer potions.

Note: You must exit the colony to use the Nightmare Zone minigame teleport to reach Yanille.

  • Talk to Wizard Frumscone in the basement of the Wizards' Guild in Yanille. ( 2)…
    2I'll see what the necromancer needs me to do.

Note: The southern portal on the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] of the Wizards' Guild will teleport you to the Dark Wizards' Tower, just north-west of Malignius Mortifer.

  • Talk to Malignius Mortifer south of Falador. ( 2)…
    2I need help with saving a fishing colony.
    He will give you a brown apron in order to be allowed entry to the Crafting Guild.
  • Talk to the Master Crafter with dreadlocks in the Crafting Guild on the east side.
    • If you brought soft clay, use it on the potter's wheel, then the potter's oven to make a pot and pot lid. If you brought a pickaxe, mine some clay and follow the step above.
  • Use Pot and Pot Lid together to make Airtight Pot.

Note: Malignius Mortifer will refuse to give you bone seeds if you are wearing or holding Saradomin-affiliated gear. It is not suggested to drop any gear as you will be teleported back to the Fishing Colony.

  • Talk to Malignius Mortifer to teleport back to the Fishing Colony. ( 2)…
    2I've spoken to the master crafter...

The Final Battle[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Food, Armour, Melee or Ranged weapon, Prayer potions, Bone seeds.
 This fight takes place in an instanced area.
On death, all unprotected items will be moved to a grave outside the instance. Any items left on the ground will be lost.
  • Talk to Herman to begin the fight. ( 1)…
    1I'm ready. Let's fight!
  • Kill the Sea Troll Queen. (Use Protect from Magic in Melee range, and use Ranged or Melee to kill her)
  • Talk to Herman.
  • (Optional) Catch and cook a monkfish to complete a hard Western Provinces Achievement Diary task.

Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 2 Quest points
  • 15,000 Magic experience
  • 10,000 Prayer experience
  • 10,000 Fishing experience
  • 25,000 coins
  • Access to the Piscatoris Fishing Colony
    • The ability to fish monkfish
    • The ability to use Skeleton Mages for training
  • Access to the following items from Malignius Mortifer upon request:
    • A brown apron
    • Bone seeds (requires an airtight pot)

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

  • Making Friends with My Arm
  • Western Provinces Diary (Hard)
